task_summary: Move the robot end effector to the blue mark on the table by first detecting and locating it, approaching precisely, and verifying final position.

task_long_description.overview: The robot arm is tasked with reaching a marked blue square on a table surface. The episode unfolds in a controlled workspace with a clear tabletop and a single blue target marker. The robot uses visual perception to detect the mark, aligns its end effector above it, and verifies arrival at the target. The operation requires high localization accuracy and robust perception to ensure the end effector makes contact with the mark, as seen in a steady approach and final contact in the last frames.
preconditions: Workspace clear except for blue mark
stepwise_plan: Visually confirm presence of the blue mark
Scan for target if not directly visible, up to three times
Detect and localize the blue mark
Approach and align with the blue mark with tight tolerance
Verify arrival by checking end effector position over blue mark
success_criteria: End effector is positioned directly above the blue mark
No collision with workspace or mark
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure: retry scanning up to three times
Localization error: repeat approach and realign if necessary
Physical obstruction: abort and reattempt from start
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates when the IsAt condition passes for the blue mark.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: reach the blue mark on the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the blue mark is visible to robot sensors.
Attempts to visually scan for the blue mark up to three times in a grid pattern.
Performs detection to localize the blue mark.
Approaches and aligns end effector to the blue mark with tight (precise) tolerance.
Verifies if the end effector is at (above) the blue mark.

failure_modes: Blue mark not visible due to occlusion or lighting
Scan for target unsuccessful after retries
recovery_strategy: Retry scan for target up to three times
Abort if detection fails after retries
Allow repeated approach/alignment cycles if IsAt fails
assumptions: The blue mark is present and unoccluded in all frames except possible initial phase (frame_0)
Instruction does not specify force or timeout, so defaults used
No grasp or manipulation, pure approach task per visual evidence

expected_success_criteria: End effector visually at blue mark in final frames (frame_7, frame_8)
